Class Router

java.lang.Object
webfx.devs.Router
public class Router extends Object
This is the Router class which can be used to navigate between different pages.

    Class

    class 
    Router.HistoryData<K,V>
    Represents a key-value pair used to store the router's navigation history.

  • Constructor Details

    • Router

      public Router(String filename, javafx.scene.web.WebView webView) throws IllegalArgumentException
      This constructor of the Router class which can be used to navigate between different pages. It accepts the string of the first page to be rendered, and the current webView Throws an IllegalArgumentException if the filename is not in the templates folder
      Parameters:
      filename - , The name of the file
      webView - , WebView object
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException

  • Method Details

    • render

      public void render(String filename)
      Accepts the name of a template and renders the page
      Parameters:
      filename - , the name of the template

    • renderWithData

      public void renderWithData(String filename, String data)
      Accepts the name of a template and the data to be injected, and renders the page
      Parameters:
      filename - , the name of the template
      data - , the data to inject into the template

    • goBack

      public void goBack()
      Go back to the last page in the Router's history, maintaining the data that was rendered to that page

    • submission

      public void submission(String id, String endpoint)
      This is serves to be the method that javascript can call for form submission.

      It reads through the input fields of the specified form id and carries the data to the specified endpoint.

      Endpoints expecting data, must be have a single parameter of type Data

      Empty form values will be interpreted as null

      Parameters:
      id - , indication the form id
      endpoint - , indicating the annotated endpoint name i.e "@Endpoint(name="")"

    • mapMethods

      public HashMap<String,Method> mapMethods(Set<Method> methods)
      Returns a mapping of all endpoints with a given set of methods
      Parameters:
      methods - , A Set of methods with @Endpoint Annotations
      Returns:
      HashMap<String, Method> , of all endpoint names and methods

    • route

      public void route(String endpoint, String jsonString)
      Routes to a specific endpoint given the endpoint's name. Data as a String can also be passed, insert null if no data is being passed
      Parameters:
      endpoint - , indicating the annotated endpoint name i.e "@Endpoint(name="")"
      jsonString - , data being passed, insert null if no data is meant to be passed
